results.title: The Fight for democracy
results.creator_credit: Carl Byker, Teleac Holland, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Jigsaw Productions and PBI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Pacific century”.
This program uses the recent history of South Korea to look at the way economic success in South East Asia is leading to greater democracy. A union member, a journalist, a women’s rights activist and a successful businessman are four characters in a powerful, emotional story of people demanding a greater stake and a say in the way their nation is run. A study guide and faculty manual are available to accompany this series.

results.title: The Fight continues
results.creator_credit: Czechoslovak Film, World Health Organisation and Vaclav Bedrich
results.brief_description: This short animated film describes briefly the aims and work of the World Health Organisation: to fight disease and help give to every human being their fundamental right to the highest attainable standard of health.

results.title: The Fifties
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Life goes to the movies”.
Examines the impact of television and the courts’ decisions to separate film exhibition from production and distribution in Hollywood’s film industry during the period up to the seventies. Shows a series of film clips exemplifying the 1950’s preoccupation with romantic love themes. Suitable for Upper Secondary School Students.

results.title: The Fifth facade
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley, Film Australia and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: Records the construction and the official opening of the Sydney Opera House. Joern Utzon, the Danish architect provides the commentary and says: “One could not design a building for such an exposed position without paying attention to the roof, one must have a fifth facade”. Exterior sequences of the Opera House are blended with scenes of rehearsals.

results.title: The Fifth element [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Patrick Ledoux, Gaumont-British Instructional, Columbia and Luc Besson
results.brief_description: The Fifth Element takes an amazing glimpse into the future, with wonderful visual effects from the people who gave us “Titanic”, “Nikita” and “The Professional”, and unique costumes by visionary designer, Jean-Paul Gaultier. If the four elements are fire, water, earth and air, what is the Fifth element? What does it do? Who has control of it? These questions and others are answered as the film unfolds at a breath taking pace. This film takes you on a sci-fi thrill ride of the decade. Bruce Willis, a taxi-driver in New York city in the 23rd Century is selected as our hero. He will travel to the end of the galaxy to decide the fate of our universe. Cast includes Gary Oldman, Milla Jovovich, Ian Holm and Chris Tucker.

results.title: The Field mouse
results.creator_credit: Steve Helling and Scandinavian Videocassette Group
results.brief_description: The life cycle, habits and characteristics of the field mouse are shown in the context of its ecosystem. Highlights factors such as food availability, predators, population levels and adaptive behaviour. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Field
results.creator_credit: Noel Pearson, Granada Television International and Jim Sheridan
results.brief_description: Bull McCabe (Richard Harris) and his son Tadgh (Sean Bean) have sacrificed their lives for the sake of turning the land of a local widower into a successful field but when she says she wants to sell to the highest bidder at public auction, there is no guarantee that the McCabe’s history with the land will guarantee future ownership. Bull’s biggest fear that the field will be taken over by an outsider becomes a reality when “The American” (Tom Berenger) arrives in their small Irish town. Without any cash or other means at their disposal, the only resistance the McCabes can offer is violence, continuing a trend of tragedy that has dogged the family for years. Brenda Fricker co-stars as Bull’s silent and long suffering wife, John Hurt as the simpleton “Bird”. Set in Ireland in the 1930s and based on the play “The Field” by John B. Keane.
